intro: Trichocladus ellipticus subsp. ellipticus, commonly known as the elliptic trichocladus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
